4. Expedite Poisson-NMF estimation via alternating regression models

Yongjin Park

note_faster_nmf_approximation.Rmd

What if we apply single-effect Poisson regression alternatively? Letâ€™s consider this parameterization of Poisson distribution: Î»ij=âˆ‘kÎ²ikÎ¸jk\lambda_{ij} = \sum_{k} \beta_{ik} \theta_{jk} Previously, we introduced qijkq_{ij}^{k} (triplets for each gene ii, cell jj, and factor kk) to derive closed-form variational update equations. But the overall complexity can increase in a cubic time. Can we factorize qq into two parts, like qijk=cikzjkq_{ij}^{k} = c_{ik} z_{jk}? It will certainly lead to a more restrictive approximation objective. Perhaps, the lower-bound induced by the factored auxiliary variables will be not as tight as before. Still, we can show that some sort of alternating regression algorithm can benefit from having two factored auxiliary variables.

Let us define latent variables, Ï•ik=Î”ğ”¼[cik]\phi_{ik} \overset{\Delta}{=} \mathbb{E}\!\left[c_{ik}\right] and Ïjk=Î”ğ”¼[zjk]\rho_{jk} \overset{\Delta}{=} \mathbb{E}\!\left[z_{jk}\right] under variational approximation:

q(ğœi|Ï•i)=âˆkÏ•ikcik,q(ğ³j|Ïj)=âˆkÏjkzjkq(\mathbf{c}_{i}|\phi_{i}) = \prod_{k} \phi_{ik}^{c_{ik}}, \, q(\mathbf{z}_{j}|\rho_{j}) = \prod_{k} \rho_{jk}^{z_{jk}}

Regression 1: Approximation from the rowsâ€™ perspective

We want to estimate Î²ik\beta_{ik} given Î¸jk\theta_{jk}.

âˆ‘i,jYijln(âˆ‘kÎ²ikÎ¸jk)âˆ’âˆ‘i,j,kÎ²ikÎ¸jkâ‰¥âˆ‘i,kâˆ‘jYijciklnÎ²ikÎ¸jkcikâˆ’âˆ‘i,j,kÎ²ikÎ¸jk\sum_{i,j} Y_{ij} \ln \left( \sum_{k} \beta_{ik} \theta_{jk} \right) - \sum_{i,j,k} \beta_{ik}\theta_{jk} \ge \sum_{i,k} \sum_{j} Y_{ij} c_{ik} \ln \frac{\beta_{ik} \theta_{jk}}{c_{ik}} - \sum_{i,j,k}\beta_{ik}\theta_{jk}

Find the most correlated factor kk (softly).

lnÏ•ik=âˆ‘jYijğ”¼[lnÎ¸jk]âˆ‘jYijâŸğ–¾ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—‚ğ—‹ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–ºğ—… ğ–¼ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—…ğ–ºğ—ğ—‚ğ—ˆğ—‡+ğ”¼[lnÎ²ik]âŸğ—†ğ–¾ğ—†ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—’+ğ–¼ğ—ˆğ—‡ğ—Œğ—.\ln \phi_{ik} = \underbrace{\frac{\sum_{j} Y_{ij} \mathbb{E}\!\left[\ln \theta_{jk}\right]}{\sum_{j} Y_{ij}}}_{\textsf{empirical correlation}} + \underbrace{\mathbb{E}\!\left[\ln \beta_{ik}\right]}_{\textsf{memory}} + \textsf{const.}

with âˆ‘kÏ•ik=1\sum_{k} \phi_{ik} = 1, and Î²ikâˆ¼Gamma(a0+Ï•ikâˆ‘jYij,b0+âˆ‘jğ”¼[Î¸jk])\beta_{ik} \sim \operatorname{Gamma}\left( a_{0} + \phi_{ik} \sum_{j} Y_{ij}, \, b_{0} + \sum_{j} \mathbb{E}\!\left[\theta_{jk}\right] \right)

Î¸jkâˆ¼Gamma(a0+Ïjkâˆ‘iÏ•ikYij,b0+âˆ‘iğ”¼[Î²ik])\theta_{jk} \sim \operatorname{Gamma}\left( a_0 + \rho_{jk} \sum_{i} \phi_{ik} Y_{ij} ,\, b_0 + \sum_{i} \mathbb{E}\!\left[\beta_{ik}\right] \right)

Regression 2: Approximation from the columnsâ€™ perspective

âˆ‘i,jYijln(âˆ‘kÎ²ikÎ¸jk)âˆ’âˆ‘i,j,kÎ²ikÎ¸jkâ‰¥âˆ‘j,kâˆ‘iYijzjklnÎ²ikÎ¸jkzjkâˆ’âˆ‘i,j,kÎ²ikÎ¸jk\sum_{i,j} Y_{ij} \ln \left( \sum_{k} \beta_{ik} \theta_{jk} \right) - \sum_{i,j,k} \beta_{ik}\theta_{jk} \ge \sum_{j,k} \sum_{i} Y_{ij} z_{jk} \ln \frac{\beta_{ik} \theta_{jk}}{z_{jk}} - \sum_{i,j,k} \beta_{ik} \theta_{jk}

lnÏjk=âˆ‘iYijğ”¼[lnÎ²ik]âˆ‘iYijâŸğ–¾ğ—†ğ—‰ğ—‚ğ—‹ğ—‚ğ–¼ğ–ºğ—… ğ–¼ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—‹ğ–¾ğ—…ğ–ºğ—ğ—‚ğ—ˆğ—‡+ğ”¼[lnÎ¸jk]âŸğ—†ğ–¾ğ—†ğ—ˆğ—‹ğ—’+ğ–¼ğ—ˆğ—‡ğ—Œğ—.\ln \rho_{jk} = \underbrace{\frac{\sum_{i} Y_{ij} \mathbb{E}\!\left[\ln \beta_{ik}\right]}{\sum_{i} Y_{ij}}}_{\textsf{empirical correlation}} + \underbrace{\mathbb{E}\!\left[\ln \theta_{jk}\right]}_{\textsf{memory}} + \textsf{const.}

where âˆ‘kÏjk=1\sum_{k} \rho_{jk} = 1, and

Î¸jkâˆ¼Gamma(a0+Ïjkâˆ‘iYij,b0+âˆ‘iğ”¼[Î²ik])\theta_{jk} \sim \operatorname{Gamma}\left( a_{0} + \rho_{jk} \sum_{i} Y_{ij},\, b_{0} + \sum_{i} \mathbb{E}\!\left[\beta_{ik}\right] \right)

Î²ikâˆ¼Gamma(a0+Ï•ikâˆ‘jYijÏjk,b0+âˆ‘jğ”¼[Î¸jk])\beta_{ik} \sim \operatorname{Gamma}\left( a_{0} + \phi_{ik} \sum_{j} Y_{ij} \rho_{jk}, \, b_{0} + \sum_{j} \mathbb{E}\!\left[\theta_{jk}\right] \right)

Final remark

As a result, we will maximize the following lower-bound:

Lâ‰¥âˆ‘i,j,kYijÏ•ikÏjklnÎ²ikÎ¸jkÏ•ikÏjkâˆ’âˆ‘i,j,kÎ²ikÎ¸jk.L \ge \sum_{i,j,k} Y_{ij} \phi_{ik} \rho_{jk} \ln \frac{\beta_{ik} \theta_{jk}}{\phi_{ik} \rho_{jk}} - \sum_{i,j,k} \beta_{ik} \theta_{jk}.

Example 

library(asapR)
library(pheatmap)

set.seed(1331)
d <- 500
n <- 5000
.rnorm <- function(d1,d2) matrix(rnorm(d1 * d2), d1, d2)

uu <- pmax(.rnorm(d, 5), 0)
vv <- pmax(.rnorm(n, 5), 0)
Y <- uu %*% t(vv) + pmax(.rnorm(d, n), 0)
system.time(out <- asap_fit_pmf(Y, maxK=7))
##    user  system elapsed 
## 206.659 327.108  41.356
u.order <- order(apply(uu, 1, which.max))
pheatmap(out$log.beta[u.order, ], Rowv=NA, Colv=NA, cluster_rows = F, cluster_cols = F)

v.order <- order(apply(vv, 1, which.max))
pheatmap(out$log.theta[v.order, ], Rowv=NA, Colv=NA, cluster_rows = F, cluster_cols = F)
